items.text: crunched! Full on middle, and he's down on one knee to sweep. Struck well, wide enough of the sweeper-fielder on the leg side
items.shortText: Santner to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball on middle, and Saifuddin skips down the wicket. Lifts this over mid-on, and enough behind the shot to earn four runs
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Saifuddin, FOUR runs

items.text: full, just outside off, and he brings out a comfortable cover drive to the man in the deep
back of a length on leg stump, and Saifuddin ducks under the ball
items.postText: Mohammad Isam: "Bangladesh will try to minimise the margin of defeat, and ensure at least these two at the crease get some batting under their belt."
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: length ball on middle, and angling away from Saifuddin. He sways away from the ball's line
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: knee-high full toss on off stump, and drilled to mid-off. Intercepted
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.preText: Imran: "Where is Mithun?" -- in the dugout, with a hamstring tear
items.text: low full toss on his pads, and flicked off his toes to deep backward square

items.preText: Tim: "Concerning the World Cup, whats going on in this game right now this is better for Bangladesh than NZ."
items.text: length ball on off, and turning into the left-hander. He makes room to cut in front of square to extra cover
clean as a whistel! Full on off, and he pounces onto that fast. Slog-sweeps for 89metres beyond the midwicket boundary. Not good for Santner's confidence
items.shortText: Santner to Sabbir Rahman, SIX runs

items.text: length ball, just outside off and he drags the length back after seeing Sabbir charge. Cut to point
items.shortText: Santner to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: length ball on off, and he swings over midwicket this time! Muscles a pull past the fielder stationned near the boundary
items.shortText: Santner to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

items.text: full on off stump, and driven down the ground to long off. Hundred-run stand between these two
length ball outside leg stump, and clipped off his hips to backward square for one
and he strikes first ball! Back of a length on off, and he tries to drag a pull. Bat's face turns in his hand, and he slices the shot in the air. No mistake from midwicket
items.postText: Ojas: "I get really worried when someone is saying BD is playing bad cricket as they are coming after playing BPL. India will go to world cup after playing IPL. I can see world cup slipping out of India's hands :)"

dismissal.text: Mohammad Saifuddin c Guptill b Boult 44 (79m 63b 4x4 0x6) SR: 69.84

items.text: length ball on middle, cramping the batsman for room. Mistimes the pull to midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, and gently tapped away to square leg. Nice early call for a single
back of a length on middle, and going down the leg side. Latham dives to his left to intercept
length ball just outside off, but angling in. Firmly defended off the back foot by Sabbir
items.shortText: Boult to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: back of a length on off, and the ball soars over the batsman's head to the keeper
full outside off, and he leans in beautifully to drive. Struck well, but straight to cover
items.shortText: Boult to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: slapped! But only for a single. Width offered, and he rides the bounce to cut square
items.postText: OB Jato: "I'm pretty sure it's not a T20 mentality affecting Bangladesh, even though shifting the IPL to some other time would have been the best option. It's just a general inability to play against very good bowling in foreign conditions, seen for some time now. It's just a general inability seen for some time in Bangladesh cricket, not to be blamed on a league which should be producing better cricketers, not worse mentalities"

items.text: dropped! Back of a length on middle, and he tries to pull. Gloves it to Latham, who can't hold on to the ball going over his head. Managed to get a hand to it, but didn't time his jump too well
length ball on middle, cramping Mashrafe for space. Nudged to square leg for one
back of a length outside off, and he cuts in front of square. Diving effort from the fielder at cover stops the boundary

Number four for Southee! Short again, and Mashrafe tries to muscle this over backward square leg. Top-edges it to fine leg where Boult does well to hang on to the catch. Checks his feet, and they're nowhere near the boundary. The Bangladesh captain makes his way back

dismissal.text: Mashrafe Mortaza c Boult b Southee 2 (8m 3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 66.66
